intro: Appendicula biloba var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf appendicula, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant has a basal rosette of leaves that are narrow and lance-shaped, giving it its varietal name. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in the wild.
